office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
description: The Committee on Oversight and Government Reform is the primary investigative committee of the U.S. House of Representatives. Rep. Elijah E. Cummings, the Ranking Member, is seeking an Investigative Counsel to join the Democratic staff to participate in all matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction, including investigations, hearings, depositions, transcribed interviews, and briefings. The ideal candidate will be an attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience. Candidates must have superior attention to detail, work well under pressure, be self-motivated, and possess excellent written and oral communication skills. Candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences are strongly encouraged to apply.
qualifications: Attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience
Ability to work well under pressure
Excellent written and oral communication skills
how_to_apply: Please send a resume and cover letter to oversightjobs@mail.house.gov, with “Investigative Counsel” in the subject line.

description: Individual will develop strategies to increase outreach to LES and represent the office at public meetings. Ideal candidate should have strong knowledge of LES community. Excellent verbal/written communication skills a plus.
responsibilities: Develop strategies to increase outreach to LES
Represent the office at public meetings
qualifications: Excellent verbal/written communication skills a plus

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
description: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business seeks a professional staff member to handle matters including but not limited to agency oversight, procurement, financial services, health, and/or technology.
qualifications: Previous legislative experience is not necessary but preferred.
The candidate must possess superior writing and analytic abilities, including strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
how_to_apply: To apply, please email cover letter and resume to vacancy_employment@yahoo.com. No phone calls or drop-ins please.

description: Responsibilities include greeting visitors, answering the telephone, scheduling tours and responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries. This position also monitors delivery and pickup of materials, maintains the front office, and assists with various administrative duties. The Staff Assistant must maintain a good relationship with the Member, staff and constituents, accept performance based criticism and direction, and work well under pressure. The applicant must be prepared to work a flexible schedule.
responsibilities: Responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries
Monitoring delivery and pickup of materials
Maintaining a good relationship with the Member, staff and constituents
Accepting performance based criticism and direction
Prepared to work a flexible schedule
qualifications: Previous Hill experience preferred but not required
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter and resume to castaffassistant1996@gmail.com. No phone calls or drop-ins please.

description: The District Director will oversee management and operation of two District offices, serve as a key liaison to local organizations and elected officials, and develop and implement long-term strategic plans. Qualified candidates will demonstrate significant management experience, strong oral and written communications skills , self-motivation and outreach experience to local and state organizations. In addition, qualified candidates with have prior experience in coalition building, a thorough understanding of the federal legislative process and in-depth knowledge of Southern CA. The position requires the ability to multi-task, work well under pressure and the flexibility to work long hours, including nights and weekends. Ties to California’s 36th Congressional District are preferred and the position is based in Palm Desert, CA.
responsibilities: Oversee management and operation of two District offices
Serve as a key liaison to local organizations and elected officials
Develop and implement long-term strategic plans
qualifications: Strong oral and written communications skills
Outreach experience to local and state organizations
Thorough understanding of the federal legislative process
Ability to work well under pressure
Flexibility to work long hours, including nights and weekends
Ties to California’s 36th Congressional District are preferred
how_to_apply: To apply for the District Director position, please send cover letter and resume to CA36DistrictDirectorposition@mail.house.gov with “District Director” in the subject line. This is NOT an entry-level position. No phone calls, drop-ins or faxes.
equal_opportunity: The office is an equal opportunity employer.

description: U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett (D-Texas) seeks a press secretary for his Washington office.
how_to_apply: Send resume, brief writing sample, and three references to DoggettJobs@mail.house.gov. No drop-ins please.

office: Senior Member of the Bay Area California Delegation
description: to assume the responsibilities of managing the front office. Daily tasks include answering telephones; organizing tours; greeting visitors; processing flag requests; assisting legislative staff; and serving as Intern Coordinator.
qualifications: Applicants with ties to the Bay Area are strongly encouraged to apply.
how_to_apply: Please e-mail cover letter and resume to StaffAssistantCalifornia@gmail.com. No phone calls, e-mails or walk-ins, please.
